00042 /*
00043  * - lustre_rsync is a tool for replicating a lustre filesystem.
00044  *
00045  * - The source-fs is a live lustre filesystem. It is not a
00046  * snapshot. It is mounted and undergoing changes
00047  *
00048  * - The target-fs is a copy of the source-fs from the past. Let's
00049  * call this point, the 'sync point'.
00050  *
00051  * - There is a changelog of all metadata operations that happened on
00052  * the filesystem since the 'sync point'.
00053  *
00054  * - lustre_rsync replicates all the operations saved in the changelog
00055  * on to the target filesystem to make it identical to the source.
00056  *
00057  * To facilitate replication, the lustre filesystem provides
00058  *    a) a way to get the current filesystem path of a given FID
00059  *    b) a way to open files by specifying its FID
00060  *
00061  * The changelog only has a limited amount of information.
00062  *  tfid - The FID of the target file
00063  *  pfid - The FID of the parent of the target file (at the time of
00064  *         the operation)
00065  *  sfid - The FID of the source file
00066  *  spfid - The FID of the parent of the source file
00067  *  name - The name of the target file (at the time of the operation), the name
00068  *         of the source file is appended (delimited with '\0') if this
00069  *         operation involves a source
00070  *
00071  * With just this information, it is not alwasy possible to determine
00072  * the file paths for each operation. For instance, if pfid does not
00073  * exist on the source-fs (due to a subsequent deletion), its path
00074  * cannot be queried. In such cases, lustre_rsync keeps the files in a
00075  * special directory ("/.lustrerepl"). Once all the operations in a
00076  * changelog are replayed, all the files in this special directory
00077  * will get moved to the location as in the source-fs.
00078  *
00079  * Shorthand used: f2p(fid) = fid2path(fid)
00080  *
00081  * The following are the metadata operations of interest.
00082  * 1. creat
00083  *    If tfid is absent on the source-fs, ignore this operation
00084  *    If pfid is absent on the source-fs [or]
00085  *    if f2p(pfid) is not present on target-fs [or]
00086  *    if f2p(pfid)+name != f2p(tfid)
00087  *      creat .lustrerepl/tfid
00088  *      track [pfid,tfid,name]
00089  *    Else
00090  *      creat f2p[tfid]
00091  *
00092  * 2. remove
00093  *    If .lustrerepl/[tfid] is present on the target
00094  *      rm .lustrerepl/[tfid]
00095  *    Else if pfid is present on the source-fs,
00096  *      if f2p(pfid)+name is present,
00097  *        rm f2p(pfid)+name
00098  *
00099  * 3. move (spfid,sname) to (pfid,name)
00100  *    If pfid is present
00101  *      if spfid is also present, mv (spfid,sname) to (pfid,name)
00102  *      else mv .lustrerepl/[sfid] to (pfid,name)
00103  *    Else if pfid is not present,
00104  *      if spfid is present, mv (spfid,sname) .lustrerepl/[sfid]
00105  *    If moving out of .lustrerepl
00106  *      move out all its children in .lustrerepl.
00107  *      [pfid,tfid,name] tracked from (1) is used for this.
00108  */
00109

00151 /* Information for processing a changelog record. This structure is
00152    allocated on the heap instead of allocating large variables on the
00153    stack. */
00154 struct lr_info {
00155         long long recno;
00156         int target_no;
00157         unsigned int is_extended:1;
00158         enum changelog_rec_type type;
00159         char tfid[LR_FID_STR_LEN];
00160         char pfid[LR_FID_STR_LEN];
00161         char sfid[LR_FID_STR_LEN];
00162         char spfid[LR_FID_STR_LEN];

00164         char name[NAME_MAX + 1];
00165         char src[PATH_MAX + 1];
00166         char dest[PATH_MAX + 1];

00174

00230 /* Command line usage */
00231 void lr_usage()
00232 {
00233         fprintf(stderr, "\tlustre_rsync -s <lustre_root_path> -t <target_path> "
00234                 "-m <mdt> -r <user id> -l <status log>\n"
00235                 "lustre_rsync can also pick up parameters from a "
00236                 "status log created earlier.\n"
00237                 "\tlustre_rsync -l <log_file>\n"
00238                 "options:\n"
00239                 "\t--xattr <yes|no> replicate EAs\n"
00240                 "\t--abort-on-err   abort at first err\n"
00241                 "\t--verbose\n"
00242                 "\t--dry-run        don't write anything\n");
00243 }

00245 #define DEBUG_ENTRY(info)                                                      \
00246         lr_debug(D_TRACE, "***** Start %lld %s (%d) %s %s %s *****\n",         \
00247                  (info)->recno, changelog_type2str((info)->type),              \
00248                  (info)->type, (info)->tfid, (info)->pfid, (info)->name);
00249 
00250 #define DEBUG_EXIT(info, rc)                                                   \
00251         lr_debug(D_TRACE, "##### End %lld %s (%d) %s %s %s rc=%d #####\n",     \
00252                  (info)->recno, changelog_type2str((info)->type),              \
00253                  (info)->type, (info)->tfid, (info)->pfid, (info)->name, rc);

00255 /* Print debug information. This is controlled by the value of the
00256    global variable 'debug' */
00257 void lr_debug(int level, const char *fmt, ...)
00258 {
00259         va_list ap;
00260 
00261         if (level > debug)
00262                 return;
00263 
00264         va_start(ap, fmt);
00265         if (debug_log != NULL)
00266                 vfprintf(debug_log, fmt, ap);
00267         else
00268                 vfprintf(stdout, fmt, ap);
00269         va_end(ap);
00270 }

00273 void * lr_grow_buf(void *buf, int size)
00274 {
00275         void *ptr;
00276 
00277         ptr = realloc(buf, size);
00278         if (ptr == NULL)
00279                 free(buf);
00280         return ptr;
00281 }

00284 /* Use rsync to replicate file data */
00285 int lr_rsync_data(struct lr_info *info)
00286 {
00287         int rc;
00288         struct stat st_src, st_dest;
00289         char cmd[PATH_MAX];
00290 
00291         lr_debug(DTRACE, "Syncing data%s\n", info->tfid);
00292 
00293         rc = stat(info->src, &st_src);
00294         if (rc == -1) {
00295                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Unable to stat src=%s %s\n",
00296                         info->src, info->name);
00297                 if (errno == ENOENT)
00298                         return 0;
00299                 else
00300                         return -errno;
00301         }
00302         rc = stat(info->dest, &st_dest);
00303         if (rc == -1) {
00304                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Unable to stat dest=%s\n",
00305                         info->dest);
00306                 return -errno;
00307         }
00308 
00309         if (st_src.st_mtime != st_dest.st_mtime ||
00310             st_src.st_size != st_dest.st_size) {
00311                 /* XXX spawning off an rsync for every data sync and
00312                  * waiting synchronously is bad for performance.
00313                  * librsync could possibly used here. But it does not
00314                  * seem to be of production grade. Multi-threaded
00315                  * replication is also to be considered.
00316                  */
00317                 int status;
00318                 snprintf(cmd, PATH_MAX, "%s --inplace %s %s", rsync, info->src,
00319                         info->dest);
00320                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "\t%s %s\n", cmd, info->tfid);
00321                 status = system(cmd);
00322                 if (status == -1) {
00323                         rc = -errno;
00324                 } else if (WIFEXITED(status)) {
00325                         status = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00326                         if (!status)
00327                                 rc = 0;
00328                         else if (status == 23 || status == 24)
00329                                 /* Error due to vanished source files;
00330                                    Ignore this error*/
00331                                 rc = 0;
00332                         else
00333                                 rc = -EINVAL;
00334                         if (status)
00335                                 lr_debug(DINFO, "rsync %s exited with %d %d\n",
00336                                          info->src, status, rc);
00337                 } else {
00338                         rc = -EINTR;
00339                 }
00340         } else {
00341                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "Not syncing %s and %s %s\n", info->src,
00342                          info->dest, info->tfid);
00343         }
00344 
00345         return rc;
00346 }
00347 
00348 int lr_copy_data(struct lr_info *info)
00349 {
00350         int fd_src = -1;
00351         int fd_dest = -1;
00352         int bufsize;
00353         int rsize;
00354         int rc = 0;
00355         struct stat st_src;
00356         struct stat st_dest;
00357 
00358         fd_src = open(info->src, O_RDONLY);
00359         if (fd_src == -1)
00360                 return -errno;
00361         if (fstat(fd_src, &st_src) == -1 ||
00362             stat(info->dest, &st_dest) == -1)
00363                 goto out;
00364 
00365         if (st_src.st_mtime == st_dest.st_mtime &&
00366             st_src.st_size == st_dest.st_size)
00367                 goto out;
00368 
00369         if (st_src.st_size > rsync_threshold && rsync[0] != '\0') {
00370                 /* It is more efficient to use rsync to replicate
00371                    large files. Any file larger than rsync_threshold
00372                    is handed off to rsync. */
00373                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "Using rsync to replicate %s\n", info->tfid);
00374                 rc = lr_rsync_data(info);
00375                 goto out;
00376         }
00377 
00378         fd_dest = open(info->dest, O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC, st_src.st_mode);
00379         if (fd_dest == -1) {
00380                 rc = -errno;
00381                 goto out;
00382         }
00383         bufsize = st_dest.st_blksize;
00384 
00385         if (info->bufsize < bufsize) {
00386                 /* Grow buffer */
00387                 info->buf = lr_grow_buf(info->buf, bufsize);
00388                 if (info->buf == NULL) {
00389                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00390                         goto out;
00391                 }
00392                 info->bufsize = bufsize;
00393         }
00394 
00395         while (1) {
00396                 char *buf;
00397                 int wsize;
00398 
00399                 buf = info->buf;
00400                 rsize = read(fd_src, buf, bufsize);
00401                 if (rsize == 0) {
00402                         rc = 0;
00403                         break;
00404                 }
00405                 if (rsize < 0) {
00406                         rc = -errno;
00407                         break;
00408                 }
00409                 do {
00410                         wsize = write(fd_dest, buf, rsize);
00411                         if (wsize <= 0) {
00412                                 rc = -errno;
00413                                 break;
00414                         }
00415                         rsize -= wsize;
00416                         buf += wsize;
00417                 } while (rsize > 0);
00418         }
00419         fsync(fd_dest);
00420 
00421 out:
00422         if (fd_src != -1)
00423                 close(fd_src);
00424         if (fd_dest != -1)
00425                 close(fd_dest);
00426 
00427         return rc;
00428 }
00429 
00430 /* Copy data from source to destination */
00431 int lr_sync_data(struct lr_info *info)
00432 {
00433         if (use_rsync)
00434                 return lr_rsync_data(info);
00435         else
00436                 return lr_copy_data(info);
00437 }
00438 
00439 /* Copy all attributes from file src to file dest */
00440 int lr_copy_attr(char *src, char *dest)
00441 {
00442         struct stat st;
00443         struct utimbuf time;
00444 
00445         if (stat(src, &st) == -1 ||
00446             chmod(dest, st.st_mode) == -1 ||
00447             chown(dest, st.st_uid, st.st_gid) == -1)
00448                 return -errno;
00449 
00450         time.actime = st.st_atime;
00451         time.modtime = st.st_mtime;
00452         if (utime(dest, &time) == -1)
00453                 return -errno;
00454         return 0;
00455 }
00456 
00457 /* Copy all xattrs from file info->src to info->dest */
00458 int lr_copy_xattr(struct lr_info *info)
00459 {
00460         size_t size = info->xsize;
00461         int start;
00462         int len;
00463         int rc;
00464 
00465         if (noxattr)
00466                 return 0;
00467 
00468         errno = 0;
00469         rc = llistxattr(info->src, info->xlist, size);
00470         lr_debug(DTRACE, "llistxattr(%s,%p) returned %d, errno=%d\n",
00471                  info->src, info->xlist, rc, errno);
00472         if ((rc > 0 && info->xlist == NULL) || errno == ERANGE) {
00473                 size = rc > PATH_MAX ? rc : PATH_MAX;
00474                 info->xlist = lr_grow_buf(info->xlist, size);
00475                 if (info->xlist == NULL)
00476                         return -ENOMEM;
00477                 info->xsize = size;
00478                 rc = llistxattr(info->src, info->xlist, size);
00479                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "llistxattr %s returned %d, errno=%d\n",
00480                          info->src, rc, errno);
00481         }
00482         if (rc < 0)
00483                 return rc;
00484 
00485         len = rc;
00486         start = 0;
00487         while (start < len) {
00488                 size = info->xvsize;
00489                 rc = lgetxattr(info->src, info->xlist + start,
00490                                info->xvalue, size);
00491                 if (info->xvalue == NULL || errno == ERANGE) {
00492                         size = rc > PATH_MAX ? rc : PATH_MAX;
00493                         info->xvalue = lr_grow_buf(info->xvalue, size);
00494                         if (info->xvalue == NULL)
00495                                 return -ENOMEM;
00496                         info->xvsize = size;
00497                         rc = lgetxattr(info->src, info->xlist + start,
00498                                        info->xvalue, size);
00499                 }
00500                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "\t(%s,%d) rc=%p\n", info->xlist + start,
00501                          info->xvalue, rc);
00502                 if (rc > 0) {
00503                         size = rc;
00504                         rc = lsetxattr(info->dest, info->xlist + start,
00505                                        info->xvalue, size, 0);
00506                         lr_debug(DTRACE, "\tlsetxattr(), rc=%d, errno=%d\n",
00507                                  rc, errno);
00508                         if (rc == -1) {
00509                                 if (errno != ENOTSUP) {
00510                                         fprintf(stderr, "Error replicating "
00511                                                 " xattr for %s: %d\n",
00512                                                 info->dest, errno);
00513                                         errors++;
00514                                 }
00515                                 rc = 0;
00516                         }
00517                 }
00518                 start += strlen(info->xlist + start) + 1;
00519         }
00520 
00521         lr_debug(DINFO, "setxattr: %s %s\n", info->src, info->dest);
00522 
00523         return rc;
00524 }

00526 /* Retrieve the filesystem path for a given FID and a given
00527    linkno. The path is returned in info->path */
00528 int lr_get_path_ln(struct lr_info *info, char *fidstr, int linkno)
00529 {
00530         long long recno = -1;
00531         int rc;
00532 
00533         rc = llapi_fid2path(status->ls_source, fidstr, info->path,
00534                             PATH_MAX, &recno, &linkno);
00535         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOENT) {
00536                 fprintf(stderr, "fid2path error: (%s, %s) %d %s\n",
00537                         status->ls_source, fidstr, -rc, strerror(errno = -rc));
00538         }
00539 
00540         return rc;
00541 }
00542 
00543 /* Retrieve the filesystem path for a given FID. The path is returned
00544    in info->path */
00545 int lr_get_path(struct lr_info *info, char *fidstr)
00546 {
00547         return lr_get_path_ln(info, fidstr, 0);
00548 }
00549 
00550 /* Generate the path for opening by FID */
00551 void lr_get_FID_PATH(char *mntpt, char *fidstr, char *buf, int bufsize)
00552 {
00553         /* Open-by-FID path is <mntpt>/.lustre/fid/[SEQ:OID:VER] */
00554         snprintf(buf, bufsize, "%s/%s/fid/%s", mntpt, dot_lustre_name,
00555                  fidstr);
00556         return;
00557 }
00558 
00559 /* Read the symlink information into 'info->link' */
00560 int lr_get_symlink(struct lr_info *info)
00561 {
00562         int rc;
00563         char *link;
00564 
00565         lr_get_FID_PATH(status->ls_source, info->tfid, info->src, PATH_MAX);
00566         rc = readlink(info->src, info->linktmp, PATH_MAX);
00567         if (rc > 0)
00568                 info->linktmp[rc] = '\0';
00569         else
00570                 return rc;
00571         lr_debug(DTRACE, "symlink: readlink returned %s\n", info->linktmp);
00572 
00573         if (strncmp(info->linktmp, status->ls_source,
00574                     strlen(status->ls_source)) == 0) {
00575                 /* Strip source fs path and replace with target fs path. */
00576                 link = info->linktmp + strlen(status->ls_source);
00577                 snprintf(info->src, PATH_MAX, "%s%s",
00578                          status->ls_targets[info->target_no], link);
00579                 link = info->src;
00580         } else {
00581                 link = info->linktmp;
00582         }
00583         strlcpy(info->link, link, sizeof(info->link));
00584 
00585         return rc;
00586 }
00587 
00588 /* Create file/directory/device file/symlink. */
00589 int lr_mkfile(struct lr_info *info)
00590 {
00591         struct stat st;
00592         int rc = 0;
00593 
00594         errno = 0;
00595         lr_debug(DINFO, "mkfile(%d) %s \n", info->type, info->dest);
00596         if (info->type == CL_MKDIR) {
00597                 rc = mkdir(info->dest, 0777);
00598         } else if (info->type == CL_SOFTLINK) {
00599                 lr_get_symlink(info);
00600                 rc = symlink(info->link, info->dest);
00601         } else if (info->type == CL_MKNOD) {
00602                 lr_get_FID_PATH(status->ls_source, info->tfid,
00603                                     info->src, PATH_MAX);
00604                 rc = stat(info->src, &st);
00605                 if (rc == -1) {
00606                         if (errno == ENOENT)
00607                                 return 0;
00608                         else
00609                                 return -errno;
00610                 }
00611                 rc = mknod(info->dest, st.st_mode, st.st_rdev);
00612         } else {
00613                 rc = mknod(info->dest, S_IFREG | 0777, 0);
00614         }
00615         if (rc)
00616                 return -errno;
00617 
00618         /* Sync data and attributes */
00619         if (info->type == CL_CREATE || info->type == CL_MKDIR) {
00620                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "Syncing data and attributes %s\n",
00621                          info->tfid);
00622                 (void) lr_copy_xattr(info);
00623                 if (info->type == CL_CREATE)
00624                         rc = lr_sync_data(info);
00625                 if (!rc)
00626                         rc = lr_copy_attr(info->src, info->dest);
00627 
00628                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
00629                         /* Source file has disappeared. Not an error. */
00630                         rc = 0;
00631         } else {
00632                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "Not syncing data and attributes %s\n",
00633                          info->tfid);
00634         }
00635 
00636         return rc;
00637 }
00638 
00639 int lr_add_pc(const char *pfid, const char *tfid, const char *name)
00640 {
00641         struct lr_parent_child_list *p;
00642         size_t len;
00643 
00644         p = calloc(1, sizeof(*p));
00645         if (p == NULL)
00646                 return -ENOMEM;
00647         len = strlcpy(p->pc_log.pcl_pfid, pfid, sizeof(p->pc_log.pcl_pfid));
00648         if (len >= sizeof(p->pc_log.pcl_pfid))
00649                 goto out_err;
00650         len = strlcpy(p->pc_log.pcl_tfid, tfid, sizeof(p->pc_log.pcl_tfid));
00651         if (len >= sizeof(p->pc_log.pcl_tfid))
00652                 goto out_err;
00653         len = strlcpy(p->pc_log.pcl_name, name, sizeof(p->pc_log.pcl_name));
00654         if (len >= sizeof(p->pc_log.pcl_name))
00655                 goto out_err;
00656 
00657         p->pc_next = parents;
00658         parents = p;
00659         return 0;
00660 
00661 out_err:
00662         free(p);
00663         return -E2BIG;
00664 }
00665 
00666 void lr_cascade_move(const char *fid, const char *dest, struct lr_info *info)
00667 {
00668         struct lr_parent_child_list *curr, *prev;
00669         char *d;
00670         int rc;
00671 
00672         d = calloc(1, PATH_MAX + 1);
00673         prev = curr = parents;
00674         while (curr) {
00675                 if (strcmp(curr->pc_log.pcl_pfid, fid) == 0) {
00676                         snprintf(d, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s", dest,
00677                                  curr->pc_log.pcl_name);
00678                         snprintf(info->src, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00679                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
00680                                 SPECIAL_DIR, curr->pc_log.pcl_tfid);
00681                         rc = rename(info->src, d);
00682                         if (rc == -1) {
00683                                 fprintf(stderr, "Error renaming file "
00684                                         " %s to %s: %d\n",
00685                                         info->src, d, errno);
00686                                 errors++;
00687                         }
00688                         if (curr == parents)
00689                                 parents = curr->pc_next;
00690                         else
00691                                 prev->pc_next = curr->pc_next;
00692                         lr_cascade_move(curr->pc_log.pcl_tfid, d, info);
00693                         free(curr);
00694                         prev = curr = parents;
00695 
00696                 } else {
00697                         prev = curr;
00698                         curr = curr->pc_next;
00699                 }
00700         }
00701 
00702         free(d);
00703 }
00704 
00705 /* remove [info->spfid, info->sfid] from parents */
00706 int lr_remove_pc(const char *pfid, const char *tfid)
00707 {
00708         struct lr_parent_child_list *curr, *prev;
00709 
00710         for (prev = curr = parents; curr; prev = curr, curr = curr->pc_next) {
00711                 if (strcmp(curr->pc_log.pcl_pfid, pfid) == 0 &&
00712                     strcmp(curr->pc_log.pcl_tfid, tfid) == 0) {
00713                         if (curr == parents)
00714                                 parents = curr->pc_next;
00715                         else
00716                                 prev->pc_next = curr->pc_next;
00717                         free(curr);
00718                         break;
00719                 }
00720         }
00721         return 0;
00722 }
00723 
00724 /* Create file under SPECIAL_DIR with its tfid as its name. */
00725 int lr_mk_special(struct lr_info *info)
00726 {
00727         int rc;
00728 
00729         snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00730                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no], SPECIAL_DIR,
00731                 info->tfid);
00732 
00733         rc = lr_mkfile(info);
00734         if (rc)
00735                 return rc;
00736 
00737         rc = lr_add_pc(info->pfid, info->tfid, info->name);
00738         return rc;
00739 }
00740 
00741 /* Remove a file or directory */
00742 int lr_rmfile(struct lr_info *info)
00743 {
00744         int rc;
00745 
00746         if (info->type == CL_RMDIR)
00747                 rc = rmdir(info->dest);
00748         else
00749                 rc = unlink(info->dest);
00750         if (rc == -1)
00751                 rc = -errno;
00752         return rc;
00753 }
00754 
00755 /* Recursively remove directory and its contents */
00756 int lr_rm_recursive(struct lr_info *info)
00757 {
00758         int rc;
00759 
00760         snprintf(info->cmd, PATH_MAX, "rm -rf %s", info->dest);
00761         rc = system(info->cmd);
00762         if (rc == -1)
00763                 rc = -errno;
00764 
00765         return rc;
00766 }
00767 
00768 /* Remove a file under SPECIAL_DIR with its tfid as its name. */
00769 int lr_rm_special(struct lr_info *info)
00770 {
00771         int rc;
00772 
00773         snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00774                  status->ls_targets[info->target_no], SPECIAL_DIR,
00775                  info->tfid);
00776         rc = lr_rmfile(info);
00777 
00778         if (rc)
00779                 lr_debug(DINFO, "remove: %s; rc=%d, errno=%d\n",
00780                          info->dest, rc, errno);
00781         return rc;
00782 }
00783 
00784 /* Replicate file and directory create events */
00785 int lr_create(struct lr_info *info)
00786 {
00787         int len;
00788         int rc1 = 0;
00789         int rc;
00790         int mkspecial = 0;
00791 
00792         /* Is target FID present on the source? */
00793         rc = lr_get_path(info, info->tfid);
00794         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00795                 /* Source file has disappeared. Not an error. */
00796                 lr_debug(DINFO, "create: tfid %s not found on"
00797                          "source-fs\n", info->tfid);
00798                 return 0;
00799         } else if (rc) {
00800                 return rc;
00801         }
00802         strcpy(info->savedpath, info->path);
00803 
00804         /* Is parent FID present on the source */
00805         rc = lr_get_path(info, info->pfid);
00806         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00807                 lr_debug(DINFO, "create: pfid %s not found on source-fs\n",
00808                          info->tfid);
00809                 mkspecial = 1;
00810         } else if (rc < 0) {
00811                 return rc;
00812         }
00813 
00814         /* Is f2p(pfid)+name != f2p(tfid)? If not the file has moved. */
00815         len = strlen(info->path);
00816         if (len == 1 && info->path[0] == '/')
00817                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s", info->name);
00818         else if (len - 1 > 0 && info->path[len - 1] == '/')
00819                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s%s", info->path, info->name);
00820         else
00821                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s", info->path, info->name);
00822 
00823         lr_debug(DTRACE, "dest = %s; savedpath = %s\n", info->dest,
00824                  info->savedpath);
00825         if (strncmp(info->dest, info->savedpath, PATH_MAX) != 0) {
00826                 lr_debug(DTRACE, "create: file moved (%s). %s != %s\n",
00827                          info->tfid, info->dest, info->savedpath);
00828                 mkspecial = 1;
00829         }
00830 
00831         /* Is f2p(pfid) present on the target? If not, the parent has
00832            moved */
00833         if (!mkspecial) {
00834                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s", status->ls_targets[0],
00835                         info->path);
00836                 if (access(info->dest, F_OK) != 0) {
00837                         lr_debug(DTRACE, "create: parent %s not found\n",
00838                                 info->dest);
00839                         mkspecial = 1;
00840                 }
00841         }
00842         for (info->target_no = 0; info->target_no < status->ls_num_targets;
00843              info->target_no++) {
00844                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s",
00845                         status->ls_targets[info->target_no], info->savedpath);
00846                 lr_get_FID_PATH(status->ls_source, info->tfid, info->src,
00847                                     PATH_MAX);
00848 
00849                 if (!mkspecial)
00850                         rc1 = lr_mkfile(info);
00851                 if (mkspecial || rc1 == -ENOENT) {
00852                         rc1 = lr_mk_special(info);
00853                 }
00854                 if (rc1)
00855                         rc = rc1;
00856         }
00857         return rc;
00858 }
00859 
00860 /* Replicate a file remove (rmdir/unlink) operation */
00861 int lr_remove(struct lr_info *info)
00862 {
00863         int rc = 0;
00864         int rc1;
00865 
00866         for (info->target_no = 0; info->target_no < status->ls_num_targets;
00867              info->target_no++) {
00868 
00869                 rc1 = lr_rm_special(info);
00870                 if (!rc1)
00871                         continue;
00872 
00873                 rc1 = lr_get_path(info, info->pfid);
00874                 if (rc1 == -ENOENT) {
00875                         lr_debug(DINFO, "remove: pfid %s not found\n",
00876                                  info->pfid);
00877                         continue;
00878                 }
00879                 if (rc1) {
00880                         rc = rc1;
00881                         continue;
00882                 }
00883                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00884                         status->ls_targets[info->target_no], info->path,
00885                         info->name);
00886 
00887                 rc1 = lr_rmfile(info);
00888                 lr_debug(DINFO, "remove: %s; rc1=%d, errno=%d\n",
00889                          info->dest, rc1, errno);
00890                 if (rc1 == -ENOTEMPTY)
00891                         rc1 = lr_rm_recursive(info);
00892 
00893                 if (rc1) {
00894                         rc = rc1;
00895                         continue;
00896                 }
00897         }
00898         return rc;
00899 }
00900 
00901 /* Replicate a rename/move operation. */
00902 int lr_move(struct lr_info *info)
00903 {
00904         int rc = 0;
00905         int rc1;
00906         int rc_dest, rc_src;
00907         int special_src = 0;
00908         int special_dest = 0;
00909         char srcpath[PATH_MAX + 1] = "";
00910 
00911         LASSERT(info->is_extended);
00912 
00913         rc_src = lr_get_path(info, info->spfid);
00914         if (rc_src < 0 && rc_src != -ENOENT)
00915                 return rc_src;
00916         memcpy(srcpath, info->path, strlen(info->path));
00917 
00918         rc_dest = lr_get_path(info, info->pfid);
00919         if (rc_dest < 0 && rc_dest != -ENOENT)
00920                 return rc_dest;
00921 
00922         for (info->target_no = 0; info->target_no < status->ls_num_targets;
00923              info->target_no++) {
00924 
00925                 if (!rc_dest) {
00926                         snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s",
00927                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
00928                                 info->path);
00929                         if (access(info->dest, F_OK) != 0) {
00930                                 rc_dest = -errno;
00931                         } else {
00932                                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00933                                         status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
00934                                         info->path, info->name);
00935                         }
00936                         lr_debug(DINFO, "dest path %s rc_dest=%d\n", info->dest,
00937                                  rc_dest);
00938                 }
00939                 if (rc_dest == -ENOENT) {
00940                         snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00941                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
00942                                 SPECIAL_DIR, info->sfid);
00943                         special_dest = 1;
00944                         lr_debug(DINFO, "special dest %s\n", info->dest);
00945                 }
00946 
00947                 if (!rc_src) {
00948                         snprintf(info->src, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00949                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
00950                                 srcpath, info->sname);
00951                         lr_debug(DINFO, "src path %s rc_src=%d\n", info->src,
00952                                  rc_src);
00953                 }
00954                 if (rc_src == -ENOENT || (access(info->src, F_OK) != 0 &&
00955                                           errno == ENOENT)) {
00956                         snprintf(info->src, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
00957                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
00958                                 SPECIAL_DIR, info->sfid);
00959                         special_src = 1;
00960                         lr_debug(DINFO, "special src %s\n", info->src);
00961                 }
00962 
00963                 rc1 = 0;
00964                 errno = 0;
00965                 if (strcmp(info->src, info->dest) != 0) {
00966                         rc1 = rename(info->src, info->dest);
00967                         if (rc1 == -1)
00968                                 rc1 = -errno;
00969                         lr_debug(DINFO, "rename returns %d\n", rc1);
00970                 }
00971 
00972                 if (special_src)
00973                         rc1 = lr_remove_pc(info->spfid, info->sfid);
00974 
00975                 if (!special_dest)
00976                         lr_cascade_move(info->sfid, info->dest, info);
00977                 else
00978                         rc1 = lr_add_pc(info->pfid, info->sfid, info->name);
00979 
00980                 lr_debug(DINFO, "move: %s [to] %s rc1=%d, errno=%d\n",
00981                          info->src, info->dest, rc1, errno);
00982                 if (rc1)
00983                         rc = rc1;
00984         }
00985         return rc;
00986 }
00987 
00988 /* Replicate a hard link */
00989 int lr_link(struct lr_info *info)
00990 {
00991         int i;
00992         int rc;
00993         int rc1;
00994         struct stat st;
00995 
00996         lr_get_FID_PATH(status->ls_source, info->tfid, info->src, PATH_MAX);
00997         rc = stat(info->src, &st);
00998         if (rc == -1)
00999                 return -errno;
01000 
01001         for (info->target_no = 0; info->target_no < status->ls_num_targets;
01002              info->target_no++) {
01003 
01004                 info->src[0] = 0;
01005                 info->dest[0] = 0;
01006                 rc1 = 0;
01007 
01008                 /*
01009                  * The changelog record has the new parent directory FID and
01010                  * name of the target file. So info->dest can be constructed
01011                  * by getting the path of the new parent directory and
01012                  * appending the target file name.
01013                  */
01014                 rc1 = lr_get_path(info, info->pfid);
01015                 lr_debug(rc1 ? 0 : DTRACE, "\tparent fid2path %s, %s, rc=%d\n",
01016                          info->path, info->name, rc1);
01017 
01018                 if (rc1 == 0) {
01019                         snprintf(info->dest, sizeof(info->dest), "%s/%s/%s",
01020                                  status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
01021                                  info->path, info->name);
01022                         lr_debug(DINFO, "link destination is %s\n", info->dest);
01023                 }
01024 
01025                 /* Search through the hardlinks to get the src */
01026                 for (i = 0; i < st.st_nlink && info->src[0] == 0; i++) {
01027                         rc1 = lr_get_path_ln(info, info->tfid, i);
01028                         lr_debug(rc1 ? 0:DTRACE, "\tfid2path %s, %s, %d rc=%d\n",
01029                                  info->path, info->name, i, rc1);
01030                         if (rc1)
01031                                 break;
01032 
01033                         /*
01034                          * Compare the path of target FID with info->dest
01035                          * to find out info->src.
01036                          */
01037                         char srcpath[PATH_MAX];
01038 
01039                         snprintf(srcpath, sizeof(srcpath), "%s/%s",
01040                                  status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
01041                                  info->path);
01042 
01043                         if (strcmp(srcpath, info->dest) != 0) {
01044                                 strlcpy(info->src, srcpath, sizeof(info->src));
01045                                 lr_debug(DINFO, "link source is %s\n",
01046                                          info->src);
01047                         }
01048                 }
01049 
01050                 if (rc1) {
01051                         rc = rc1;
01052                         continue;
01053                 }
01054 
01055                 if (info->src[0] == 0)
01056                         snprintf(info->src, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
01057                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
01058                                 SPECIAL_DIR, info->tfid);
01059                 else if (info->dest[0] == 0)
01060                         snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s/%s",
01061                                 status->ls_targets[info->target_no],
01062                                 SPECIAL_DIR, info->tfid);
01063 
01064                 rc1 = link(info->src, info->dest);
01065                 lr_debug(DINFO, "link: %s [to] %s; rc1=%d %s\n",
01066                          info->src, info->dest, rc1,
01067                          strerror(rc1 ? errno : 0));
01068 
01069                 if (rc1)
01070                         rc = rc1;
01071         }
01072         return rc;
01073 }
01074 
01075 /* Replicate file attributes */
01076 int lr_setattr(struct lr_info *info)
01077 {
01078         int rc1;
01079         int rc;
01080 
01081         lr_get_FID_PATH(status->ls_source, info->tfid, info->src, PATH_MAX);
01082 
01083         rc = lr_get_path(info, info->tfid);
01084         if (rc == -ENOENT)
01085                 lr_debug(DINFO, "setattr: %s not present on source-fs\n",
01086                          info->src);
01087         if (rc)
01088                 return rc;
01089 
01090         for (info->target_no = 0; info->target_no < status->ls_num_targets;
01091              info->target_no++) {
01092 
01093                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s",
01094                          status->ls_targets[info->target_no], info->path);
01095                 lr_debug(DINFO, "setattr: %s %s %s", info->src, info->dest,
01096                          info->tfid);
01097 
01098                 rc1 = lr_sync_data(info);
01099                 if (!rc1)
01100                         rc1 = lr_copy_attr(info->src, info->dest);
01101                 if (rc1)
01102                         rc = rc1;
01103         }
01104         return rc;
01105 }
01106 
01107 /* Replicate xattrs */
01108 int lr_setxattr(struct lr_info *info)
01109 {
01110         int rc, rc1;
01111 
01112         lr_get_FID_PATH(status->ls_source, info->tfid, info->src, PATH_MAX);
01113 
01114         rc = lr_get_path(info, info->tfid);
01115         if (rc == -ENOENT)
01116                 lr_debug(DINFO, "setxattr: %s not present on source-fs\n",
01117                          info->src);
01118         if (rc)
01119                 return rc;
01120 
01121         for (info->target_no = 0; info->target_no < status->ls_num_targets;
01122              info->target_no++) {
01123 
01124                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s",
01125                         status->ls_targets[info->target_no], info->path);
01126                 lr_debug(DINFO, "setxattr: %s %s %s\n", info->src, info->dest,
01127                          info->tfid);
01128 
01129                 rc1 = lr_copy_xattr(info);
01130                 if (rc1)
01131                         rc = rc1;
01132         }
01133 
01134         return rc;
01135 }
01136 
01137 /* Parse a line of changelog entry */
01138 int lr_parse_line(void *priv, struct lr_info *info)
01139 {
01140         struct changelog_rec            *rec;
01141         struct changelog_ext_rename     *rnm;
01142         size_t                           namelen;
01143         size_t                           copylen = sizeof(info->name);
01144 
01145         if (llapi_changelog_recv(priv, &rec) != 0)
01146                 return -1;
01147 
01148         info->is_extended = !!(rec->cr_flags & CLF_RENAME);
01149         info->recno = rec->cr_index;
01150         info->type = rec->cr_type;
01151         snprintf(info->tfid, sizeof(info->tfid), DFID, PFID(&rec->cr_tfid));
01152         snprintf(info->pfid, sizeof(info->pfid), DFID, PFID(&rec->cr_pfid));
01153 
01154         namelen = strnlen(changelog_rec_name(rec), rec->cr_namelen);
01155         if (copylen > namelen + 1)
01156                 copylen = namelen + 1;
01157         strlcpy(info->name, changelog_rec_name(rec), copylen);
01158 
01159         /* Don't use rnm if CLF_RENAME isn't set */
01160         rnm = changelog_rec_rename(rec);
01161         if (rec->cr_flags & CLF_RENAME && !fid_is_zero(&rnm->cr_sfid)) {
01162                 copylen = sizeof(info->sname);
01163 
01164                 snprintf(info->sfid, sizeof(info->sfid), DFID,
01165                          PFID(&rnm->cr_sfid));
01166                 snprintf(info->spfid, sizeof(info->spfid), DFID,
01167                          PFID(&rnm->cr_spfid));
01168                 namelen = changelog_rec_snamelen(rec);
01169                 if (copylen > namelen + 1)
01170                         copylen = namelen + 1;
01171                 strlcpy(info->sname, changelog_rec_sname(rec), copylen);
01172 
01173                 if (verbose > 1)
01174                         printf("Rec %lld: %d %s %s\n", info->recno, info->type,
01175                                 info->name, info->sname);
01176         } else {
01177                 if (verbose > 1)
01178                         printf("Rec %lld: %d %s\n", info->recno, info->type,
01179                                 info->name);
01180         }
01181 
01182         llapi_changelog_free(&rec);
01183 
01184         rec_count++;
01185         return 0;
01186 }
01187 
01188 /* Initialize the replication parameters */
01189 int lr_init_status()
01190 {
01191         size_t size = sizeof(struct lustre_rsync_status) + PATH_MAX + 1;
01192 
01193         if (status != NULL)
01194                 return 0;
01195         status = calloc(size, 1);
01196         if (status == NULL)
01197                 return -ENOMEM;
01198         status->ls_version = REPLICATE_STATUS_VER;
01199         status->ls_size = size;
01200         status->ls_last_recno = -1;
01201         return 0;
01202 }
01203 
01204 /* Make a backup of the statuslog */
01205 void lr_backup_log()
01206 {
01207         char backupfile[PATH_MAX];
01208 
01209         if (logbackedup)
01210                 return;
01211         snprintf(backupfile, PATH_MAX, "%s.old", statuslog);
01212         (void) rename(statuslog, backupfile);
01213         logbackedup = 1;
01214 
01215         return;
01216 }
01217 
01218 /* Save replication parameters to a statuslog. */
01219 int lr_write_log()
01220 {
01221         int fd;
01222         size_t size;
01223         size_t write_size = status->ls_size;
01224         struct lr_parent_child_list *curr;
01225         int rc = 0;
01226 
01227         if (statuslog == NULL)
01228                 return 0;
01229 
01230         lr_backup_log();
01231 
01232         fd = open(statuslog, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_SYNC,
01233                              S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
01234         if (fd == -1) {
01235                 fprintf(stderr, "Error opening log file for writing (%s)\n",
01236                         statuslog);
01237                 return -1;
01238         }
01239         errno = 0;
01240         size = write(fd, status, write_size);
01241         if (size != write_size) {
01242                 fprintf(stderr, "Error writing to log file (%s) %d\n",
01243                         statuslog, errno);
01244                 close(fd);
01245                 return -1;
01246         }
01247 
01248         for (curr = parents; curr; curr = curr->pc_next) {
01249                 size = write(fd, &curr->pc_log, sizeof(curr->pc_log));
01250                 if (size != sizeof(curr->pc_log)) {
01251                         fprintf(stderr, "Error writing to log file (%s) %d\n",
01252                                 statuslog, errno);
01253                         rc = -1;
01254                         break;
01255                 }
01256         }
01257         close(fd);
01258         return rc;
01259 }
01260 
01261 /* Read statuslog and populate the replication parameters.  Command
01262  * line parameters take precedence over parameters in the log file.*/
01263 int lr_read_log()
01264 {
01265         struct lr_parent_child_list *tmp;
01266         struct lr_parent_child_log rec;
01267         struct lustre_rsync_status *s;
01268         int fd = -1;
01269         size_t size;
01270         size_t read_size = sizeof(struct lustre_rsync_status) + PATH_MAX + 1;
01271         int rc = 0;
01272 
01273         if (statuslog == NULL)
01274                 return 0;
01275 
01276         s = calloc(1, read_size);
01277         if (s == NULL) {
01278                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01279                 goto out;
01280         }
01281 
01282         fd = open(statuslog, O_RDONLY);
01283         if (fd == -1) {
01284                 rc = -errno;
01285                 goto out;
01286         }
01287 
01288         size = read(fd, s, read_size);
01289         if (size != read_size) {
01290                 rc = -EINVAL;
01291                 goto out;
01292         }
01293 
01294         if (read_size < s->ls_size) {
01295                 read_size = s->ls_size;
01296                 s = lr_grow_buf(s, read_size);
01297                 if (s == NULL) {
01298                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01299                         goto out;
01300                 }
01301 
01302                 if (lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
01303                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01304                         goto out;
01305                 }
01306 
01307                 size = read(fd, s, read_size);
01308                 if (size != read_size) {
01309                         rc = -EINVAL;
01310                         goto out;
01311                 }
01312         }
01313 
01314         while (read(fd, &rec, sizeof(rec)) != 0) {
01315                 tmp = calloc(1, sizeof(*tmp));
01316                 if (!tmp) {
01317                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01318                         goto out;
01319                 }
01320 
01321                 tmp->pc_log = rec;
01322                 tmp->pc_next = parents;
01323                 parents = tmp;
01324         }
01325 
01326         /* copy uninitialized fields to status */
01327         if (status->ls_num_targets == 0) {
01328                 if (status->ls_size != s->ls_size) {
01329                         status = lr_grow_buf(status, s->ls_size);
01330                         if (status == NULL) {
01331                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01332                                 goto out;
01333                         }
01334 
01335                         status->ls_size = s->ls_size;
01336                 }
01337                 status->ls_num_targets = s->ls_num_targets;
01338                 memcpy(status->ls_targets, s->ls_targets,
01339                        (PATH_MAX + 1) * s->ls_num_targets);
01340         }
01341         if (status->ls_last_recno == -1)
01342                 status->ls_last_recno = s->ls_last_recno;
01343 
01344         if (status->ls_registration[0] == '\0')
01345                 strlcpy(status->ls_registration, s->ls_registration,
01346                         sizeof(status->ls_registration));
01347 
01348         if (status->ls_mdt_device[0] == '\0')
01349                 strlcpy(status->ls_mdt_device, s->ls_mdt_device,
01350                         sizeof(status->ls_mdt_device));
01351 
01352         if (status->ls_source_fs[0] == '\0')
01353                 strlcpy(status->ls_source_fs, s->ls_source_fs,
01354                         sizeof(status->ls_source_fs));
01355 
01356         if (status->ls_source[0] == '\0')
01357                 strlcpy(status->ls_source, s->ls_source,
01358                         sizeof(status->ls_source));
01359 
01360  out:
01361         if (fd != -1)
01362                 close(fd);
01363         if (s)
01364                 free(s);
01365         return rc;
01366 }
01367 
01368 /* Clear changelogs every CLEAR_INTERVAL records or at the end of
01369    processing. */
01370 int lr_clear_cl(struct lr_info *info, int force)
01371 {
01372         char            mdt_device[LR_NAME_MAXLEN + 1];
01373         long long       rec;
01374         int             rc = 0;
01375 
01376         if (force || info->recno > status->ls_last_recno + CLEAR_INTERVAL) {
01377                 if (info->type == CL_RENAME)
01378                         rec = info->recno + 1;
01379                 else
01380                         rec = info->recno;
01381                 if (!noclear && !dryrun) {
01382                         /* llapi_changelog_clear modifies the mdt
01383                          * device name so make a copy of it until this
01384                          * is fixed.
01385                         */
01386                         strlcpy(mdt_device, status->ls_mdt_device,
01387                                 sizeof(mdt_device));
01388                         rc = llapi_changelog_clear(mdt_device,
01389                                                    status->ls_registration,
01390                                                    rec);
01391                         if (rc)
01392                                 printf("Changelog clear (%s, %s, %lld) "
01393                                        "returned %d\n", status->ls_mdt_device,
01394                                        status->ls_registration, rec, rc);
01395                 }
01396                 if (!rc && !dryrun) {
01397                         status->ls_last_recno = rec;
01398                         lr_write_log();
01399 
01400                 }
01401         }
01402 
01403         return rc;
01404 }
01405 
01406 /* Locate a usable version of rsync. At this point we'll use any
01407    version. */
01408 int lr_locate_rsync()
01409 {
01410         FILE *fp;
01411         int len;
01412 
01413         /* Locate rsync */
01414         snprintf(rsync, PATH_MAX, "%s -p %s", TYPE, RSYNC);
01415         fp = popen(rsync, "r");
01416         if (fp == NULL)
01417                 return -1;
01418 
01419         if (fgets(rsync, PATH_MAX, fp) == NULL) {
01420                 fclose(fp);
01421                 return -1;
01422         }
01423 
01424         len = strlen(rsync);
01425         if (len > 0 && rsync[len - 1] == '\n')
01426                 rsync[len - 1] = '\0';
01427         fclose(fp);
01428 
01429         /* Determine the version of rsync */
01430         snprintf(rsync_ver, PATH_MAX, "%s --version", rsync);
01431         fp = popen(rsync_ver, "r");
01432         if (fp == NULL)
01433                 return -1;
01434 
01435         if (fgets(rsync_ver, PATH_MAX, fp) == NULL) {
01436                 fclose(fp);
01437                 return -1;
01438         }
01439         len = strlen(rsync_ver);
01440         if (len > 0 && rsync_ver[len - 1] == '\n')
01441                 rsync_ver[len - 1] = '\0';
01442         fclose(fp);
01443 
01444         return 0;
01445 
01446 }
01447 
01448 /* Print the replication parameters */
01449 void lr_print_status(struct lr_info *info)
01450 {
01451         int i;
01452 
01453         if (!verbose)
01454                 return;
01455 
01456         printf("Lustre filesystem: %s\n", status->ls_source_fs);
01457         printf("MDT device: %s\n", status->ls_mdt_device);
01458         printf("Source: %s\n", status->ls_source);
01459         for (i = 0; i < status->ls_num_targets; i++)
01460                 printf("Target: %s\n", status->ls_targets[i]);
01461         if (statuslog != NULL)
01462                 printf("Statuslog: %s\n", statuslog);
01463         printf("Changelog registration: %s\n", status->ls_registration);
01464         printf("Starting changelog record: %jd\n",
01465                (uintmax_t)status->ls_last_recno);
01466         if (noxattr)
01467                 printf("Replicate xattrs: no\n");
01468         if (noclear)
01469                 printf("Clear changelog after use: no\n");
01470         if (use_rsync)
01471                 printf("Using rsync: %s (%s)\n", rsync, rsync_ver);
01472 }
01473 
01474 void lr_print_failure(struct lr_info *info, int rc)
01475 {
01476         fprintf(stderr, "Replication of operation failed(%d):"
01477                 " %lld %s (%d) %s %s %s\n", rc, info->recno,
01478                 changelog_type2str(info->type), info->type, info->tfid,
01479                 info->pfid, info->name);
01480 }
01481 
01482 /* Replicate filesystem operations from src_path to target_path */
01483 int lr_replicate()
01484 {
01485         void *changelog_priv;
01486         struct lr_info *info;
01487         struct lr_info *ext = NULL;
01488         time_t start;
01489         int xattr_not_supp;
01490         int i;
01491         int rc;
01492 
01493         start = time(NULL);
01494 
01495         info = calloc(1, sizeof(struct lr_info));
01496         if (info == NULL)
01497                 return -ENOMEM;
01498 
01499         rc = llapi_search_fsname(status->ls_source, status->ls_source_fs);
01500         if (rc) {
01501                 fprintf(stderr, "Source path is not a valid Lustre client "
01502                         "mountpoint.\n");
01503                 goto out;
01504         }
01505         if (status->ls_mdt_device[0] == '\0')
01506                 snprintf(status->ls_mdt_device, LR_NAME_MAXLEN, "%s%s",
01507                         status->ls_source_fs, DEFAULT_MDT);
01508 
01509         ext = calloc(1, sizeof(struct lr_info));
01510         if (ext == NULL) {
01511                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01512                 goto out;
01513         }
01514 
01515         for (i = 0, xattr_not_supp = 0; i < status->ls_num_targets; i++) {
01516                 snprintf(info->dest, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s", status->ls_targets[i],
01517                         SPECIAL_DIR);
01518                 rc = mkdir(info->dest, 0777);
01519                 if (rc == -1 && errno != EEXIST) {
01520                         fprintf(stderr, "Error writing to target path %s.\n",
01521                                 status->ls_targets[i]);
01522                         rc = -errno;
01523                         goto out;
01524                 }
01525                 rc = llistxattr(info->src, info->xlist, info->xsize);
01526                 if (rc == -1 && errno == ENOTSUP) {
01527                         fprintf(stderr, "xattrs not supported on %s\n",
01528                                 status->ls_targets[i]);
01529                         xattr_not_supp++;
01530                 }
01531         }
01532         if (xattr_not_supp == status->ls_num_targets)
01533                 /* None of the targets support xattrs. */
01534                 noxattr = 1;
01535 
01536         lr_print_status(info);
01537 
01538         /* Open changelogs for consumption*/
01539         rc = llapi_changelog_start(&changelog_priv,
01540                                 CHANGELOG_FLAG_BLOCK | CHANGELOG_FLAG_JOBID,
01541                                 status->ls_mdt_device, status->ls_last_recno);
01542         if (rc < 0) {
01543                 fprintf(stderr, "Error opening changelog file for fs %s.\n",
01544                         status->ls_source_fs);
01545                 goto out;
01546         }
01547 
01548         while (!quit && lr_parse_line(changelog_priv, info) == 0) {
01549                 rc = 0;
01550                 if (info->type == CL_RENAME && !info->is_extended) {
01551                         /* Newer rename operations extends changelog to store
01552                          * source file information, but old changelog has
01553                          * another record.
01554                          */
01555                         if (lr_parse_line(changelog_priv, ext) != 0)
01556                                 break;
01557                         memcpy(info->sfid, info->tfid, sizeof(info->sfid));
01558                         memcpy(info->spfid, info->pfid, sizeof(info->spfid));
01559                         memcpy(info->tfid, ext->tfid, sizeof(info->tfid));
01560                         memcpy(info->pfid, ext->pfid, sizeof(info->pfid));
01561                         strlcpy(info->sname, info->name, sizeof(info->sname));
01562                         strlcpy(info->name, ext->name, sizeof(info->name));
01563                         info->is_extended = 1;
01564                 }
01565 
01566                 if (dryrun)
01567                         continue;
01568 
01569                 DEBUG_ENTRY(info);
01570 
01571                 switch(info->type) {
01572                 case CL_CREATE:
01573                 case CL_MKDIR:
01574                 case CL_MKNOD:
01575                 case CL_SOFTLINK:
01576                         rc = lr_create(info);
01577                         break;
01578                 case CL_RMDIR:
01579                 case CL_UNLINK:
01580                         rc = lr_remove(info);
01581                         break;
01582                 case CL_RENAME:
01583                         rc = lr_move(info);
01584                         break;
01585                 case CL_HARDLINK:
01586                         rc = lr_link(info);
01587                         break;
01588                 case CL_TRUNC:
01589                 case CL_SETATTR:
01590                         rc = lr_setattr(info);
01591                         break;
01592                 case CL_XATTR:
01593                         rc = lr_setxattr(info);
01594                         break;
01595                 case CL_CLOSE:
01596                 case CL_EXT:
01597                 case CL_OPEN:
01598                 case CL_LAYOUT:
01599                 case CL_MARK:
01600                         /* Nothing needs to be done for these entries */
01601                         /* fallthrough */
01602                 default:
01603                         break;
01604                 }
01605                 DEBUG_EXIT(info, rc);
01606                 if (rc && rc != -ENOENT) {
01607                         lr_print_failure(info, rc);
01608                         errors++;
01609                         if (abort_on_err)
01610                                 break;
01611                 }
01612                 lr_clear_cl(info, 0);
01613                 if (debug) {
01614                         bzero(info, sizeof(struct lr_info));
01615                         bzero(ext, sizeof(struct lr_info));
01616                 }
01617         }
01618 
01619         llapi_changelog_fini(&changelog_priv);
01620 
01621         if (errors || verbose)
01622                 printf("Errors: %d\n", errors);
01623 
01624         /* Clear changelog records used so far */
01625         lr_clear_cl(info, 1);
01626 
01627         if (verbose) {
01628                 printf("lustre_rsync took %ld seconds\n", time(NULL) - start);
01629                 printf("Changelog records consumed: %lld\n", rec_count);
01630         }
01631 
01632         rc = 0;
01633 
01634 out:
01635         if (info != NULL)
01636                 free(info);
01637         if (ext != NULL)
01638                 free(ext);
01639 
01640         return rc;
01641 }
01642 
01643 void
01644 termination_handler (int signum)
01645 {
01646         /* Set a flag for the replicator to gracefully shutdown */
01647         quit = 1;
01648         printf("lustre_rsync halting.\n");
01649 }
01650 
01651 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
01652 {
01653         int newsize;
01654         int numtargets = 0;
01655         int rc = 0;
01656 
01657         if ((rc = lr_init_status()) != 0)
01658                 return rc;
01659 
01660         while ((rc = getopt_long(argc, argv, "as:t:m:u:l:vx:zc:ry:n:d:D:",
01661                                  long_opts, NULL)) >= 0) {
01662                 switch (rc) {
01663                 case 'a':
01664                         /* Assume absolute paths */
01665                         abort_on_err++;
01666                         break;
01667                 case 's':
01668                         /* Assume absolute paths */
01669                         strlcpy(status->ls_source, optarg,
01670                                 sizeof(status->ls_source));
01671                         break;
01672                 case 't':
01673                         status->ls_num_targets++;
01674                         numtargets++;
01675                         if (numtargets != status->ls_num_targets) {
01676                                 /* Targets were read from a log
01677                                    file. The ones specified on the
01678                                    command line take precedence. The
01679                                    ones from the log file will be
01680                                    ignored. */
01681                                 status->ls_num_targets = numtargets;
01682                         }
01683                         newsize = sizeof (struct lustre_rsync_status) +
01684                                 (status->ls_num_targets * (PATH_MAX + 1));
01685                         if (status->ls_size != newsize) {
01686                                 status->ls_size = newsize;
01687                                 status = lr_grow_buf(status, newsize);
01688                                 if (status == NULL)
01689                                         return -ENOMEM;
01690                         }
01691                         strlcpy(status->ls_targets[status->ls_num_targets - 1],
01692                                 optarg, sizeof(status->ls_targets[0]));
01693                         break;
01694                 case 'm':
01695                         strlcpy(status->ls_mdt_device, optarg,
01696                                 sizeof(status->ls_mdt_device));
01697                         break;
01698                 case 'u':
01699                         strlcpy(status->ls_registration, optarg,
01700                                 sizeof(status->ls_registration));
01701                         break;
01702                 case 'l':
01703                         statuslog = optarg;
01704                         (void) lr_read_log();
01705                         break;
01706                 case 'v':
01707                         verbose++;
01708                         break;
01709                 case 'x':
01710                         if (strcmp("no", optarg) == 0) {
01711                                 noxattr = 1;
01712                         } else if (strcmp("yes", optarg) != 0) {
01713                                 printf("Invalid parameter %s. "
01714                                        "Specify --xattr=no or --xattr=yes\n",
01715                                        optarg);
01716                                 return -1;
01717                         }
01718                         break;
01719                 case 'z':
01720                         dryrun = 1;
01721                         break;
01722                 case 'c':
01723                         /* Undocumented option cl-clear */
01724                         if (strcmp("no", optarg) == 0) {
01725                                 noclear = 1;
01726                         } else if (strcmp("yes", optarg) != 0) {
01727                                 printf("Invalid parameter %s. "
01728                                        "Specify --cl-clear=no "
01729                                        "or --cl-clear=yes\n",
01730                                        optarg);
01731                                 return -1;
01732                         }
01733                         break;
01734                 case 'r':
01735                         /* Undocumented option use-rsync */
01736                         use_rsync = 1;
01737                         break;
01738                 case 'y':
01739                         /* Undocumented option rsync-threshold */
01740                         rsync_threshold = atol(optarg);
01741                         break;
01742                 case 'n':
01743                         /* Undocumented option start-recno */
01744                         status->ls_last_recno = atol(optarg);
01745                         break;
01746                 case 'd':
01747                         /* Undocumented option debug */
01748                         debug = atoi(optarg);
01749                         if (debug < 0 || debug > 2)
01750                                 debug = 0;
01751                         break;
01752                 case 'D':
01753                         /* Undocumented option debug log file */
01754                         if (debug_log != NULL)
01755                                 fclose(debug_log);
01756                         debug_log = fopen(optarg, "a");
01757                         if (debug_log == NULL) {
01758                                 printf("Cannot open %s for debug log\n",
01759                                        optarg);
01760                                 return -1;
01761                         }
01762                         break;
01763                 default:
01764                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' "
01765                                 "unrecognized.\n", argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
01766                         lr_usage();
01767                         return -1;
01768                 }
01769         }
01770 
01771         if (status->ls_last_recno == -1)
01772                 status->ls_last_recno = 0;
01773         if (strnlen(status->ls_registration, LR_NAME_MAXLEN) == 0) {
01774                 /* No registration ID was passed in. */
01775                 printf("Please specify changelog consumer registration id.\n");
01776                 lr_usage();
01777                 return -1;
01778         }
01779         if (strnlen(status->ls_source, PATH_MAX) == 0) {
01780                 fprintf(stderr, "Please specify the source path.\n");
01781                 lr_usage();
01782                 return -1;
01783         }
01784         if (strnlen(status->ls_targets[0], PATH_MAX) == 0) {
01785                 fprintf(stderr, "Please specify the target path.\n");
01786                 lr_usage();
01787                 return -1;
01788         }
01789 
01790         /* This plumbing is needed for some of the ioctls behind
01791            llapi calls to work. */
01792         if (obd_initialize(argc, argv) < 0) {
01793                 fprintf(stderr, "obd_initialize failed.\n");
01794                 exit(-1);
01795         }
01796 
01797         rc = lr_locate_rsync();
01798         if (use_rsync && rc != 0) {
01799                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: unable to locate %s.\n", RSYNC);
01800                 exit(-1);
01801         }
01802 
01803         signal(SIGINT, termination_handler);
01804         signal(SIGHUP, termination_handler);
01805         signal(SIGTERM, termination_handler);
01806 
01807         rc = lr_replicate();
01808 
01809         if (debug_log != NULL)
01810                 fclose(debug_log);
01811         return rc;
01812 }
